newsitem.title: USA: Kansas feedlot cattle market slow at $73 - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Kansas feedlot cattle market slow at $73 - USDA.

text.p: Trade was slow, with few sales slaughter steers and heifers steady, USDA said. Inquiry and demand moderate.

Sales confirmed on 4,700 slaughter steers and 400 slaughter heifers Thursday. For the week to date 61,600 head confirmed including 7,900 head or about 13 percent previously contracted or formulated cattle.
Sales FOB feedlot net weights after 4 percent shrink.
Slaughter steers - Select and Choice 2-3 1250-1300 lbs 73.00, Select with end Choice 1200-1250 lbs including cutting bulls 72.00. Dressed basis - Select and Choice 2-3 1200-1250 lbs 115.50-116.00.
Slaughter heifers - Few Select and Choice 2-3 1050-1125
lbs 73.00; pen Select with end Choice 1100 lbs 72.00.
Confirmed - 5,100 week ago - none year ago - 300
wk to date - 61,600 week ago - 10,100 year ago - 52,400
